titleStmt.title: Kentucky Institution for the Education of the Blind

availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

org.orgName: Kentucky Institution for the Education of the Blind

body.p: Public educational institution for visually impaired students in Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky. Created by an act of the General Assembly of the Commonwealth of Kentucky on February 5, 1842. During its first thirteen years of operation, the institution occupied several different buildings in Jefferson County before establishing a permanent location in east Louisville on October 8, 1855. Civil War-era superintendent: Bryce McLellan Patten.

ab.bibl: Adam Ruschival, "Kentucky School for the Blind" in The Kentucky Encyclopedia, John E. Kleber, ed. (Lexington: University Press of Kentucky, 1992), 511.
